page.title: 07 Osbaston Junior School
page.content: The school was opened in 1973 and was the first 'open-plan' junior school in the area.Today,the school is being re-designed from the 'open-plan' structure to traditional classrooms. The school is organised into four classes with about 105 children between 7 and 11,attending the school.The Headmaster is a teaching-head;other teaching staff are,a deputy head,and 2 assistant teachers.The 3R's play a fundamental part in the day's timetable Other subjects on the curriculum include Enviromental Studies,Creative Arts,Expressive Arts,Religious Education,Physical Education and Music. The school has built up a tradition for music.On Saturdays,an orchestra is run,which is attended by children from all neighbouring schools. There is an active Parents' Assoc., which holds various fundraising events.
